description: From Middle English unable, unabel, unhable, unhabil, equivalent to un- +‎ able.

adjectives.description: unable (comparative unabler or more unable, superlative unablest or most unable)

entries.meaning: Not able; lacking a certain ability.
examples: Are you unable to mind your own business or something?

description: From Middle English unablen, equivalent to un- +‎ able.

verbs.description: unable (third-person singular simple present unables, present participle unabling, simple past and past participle unabled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, nonstandard) To render unable; to disable.
